title: Klopp 'infected by the disease of arrogance' after winning a trophy, claims ex-Palace owner Jordan
text:
Jurgen Klopp has been accused of being 'infected by the disease of arrogance' following his 'very aggressive' post-match interview after the win over Leicester.

Former Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan, speaking on talkSPORT, felt that Klopp's behaviour has changed since he delivered a trophy for the club, guiding them to Champions League glory earlier this year.

Klopp was particularly damning of young Leicester midfielder Hamza Choudhury following the match after he produced a challenge that forced Mohamed Salah off with an injury.

Jurgen Klopp 'infected by the disease of arrogance,' claims ex-Palace owner Simon Jordan

You don't see Jurgen Klopp like this very often - he's fuming 😳#LFC #MOTD pic.twitter.com/vPRBsa8NFl — BBC Sport (@BBCSport) October 5, 2019

Jordan, reflecting on the interview by the German, said: 'Is he becoming infected by the disease of arrogance?

'I've noticed a slight change in Jurgen Klopp, in the language and robustness of his position. I thought his post-match interview was very brusque and irritable - and I know that journalists can drive you mad with ridiculous questions - in his explanation of Salah and what happened to him.

'I didn't see him complain about what Trent Alexander-Arnold had done to molest a player by dragging his studs down the back of his Achilles.

Hamza Choudhury was the focus of Klopp's post-match press conference for his Salah foul

'He was very aggressive and on the front foot about what happened to Salah.'

Liverpool are in pole position to claim their first ever Premier League title as Klopp's side, with the last-gasp victory over Leicester, opened up an eight-point lead on champions Manchester City.

James Milner's stoppage-time penalty against the Foxes ensured the club's 100 per cent start to the new league season continued heading into the international break.

But Klopp remained angered that he could be without one of his star players in Salah when they take on Manchester United following the return to domestic action and he pointed his criticisms in Choudhury's direction.
description: Klopp was damning of young Leicester midfielder Hamza Choudhury following the match after he produced a challenge that forced Mohamed Salah off with an injury.
